name: Interviews
description: One-on-one conversations with users to gather deep insights about their needs, experiences, and expectations.

name: Empathy Mapping
description: A visual tool to articulate what users say, think, feel, and do, helping designers empathise with the user's experience.

name: Affinity Diagrams
description: Used to organise and synthesise ideas and findings into meaningful groups based on natural relationships.

name: Wireframing
description: Creating low-fidelity visual guides that represent the skeletal structure of a digital product.

name: Prototyping
description: Creating early, simplified versions of a product to test and explore design ideas quickly.

name: Usability Testing
description: Evaluating a product by testing it with real users to identify and improve usability.

name: Design Critique
description: Structured feedback sessions where team members provide constructive input on design work.

name: Pilot Testing
description: Running a product with a small group of users in a real environment to validate performance before full-scale release.
